definition: to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: It's not working. We need an army of climate outlaws.
sentences.chinese: 它不掂，我们需要一队军队的气候亡命之徒。

sentences.english: Desperado, Why don, t you come to your senses?
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，为什么你还没清醒？

sentences.english: In Xiaojian leadership, swallow and others entering the fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 在箫剑的领导下，小燕子等人一起迈入亡命天涯之途。

sentences.english: Desperado, oh, you ain't getting no youger.
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，哦，你已经年华老去。

sentences.english: Desperado, oh, you aint gettin no younger.
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，哦，你已不再年轻。

sentences.english: Sarah told him that she would like to run away with them.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉告诉他，她愿意跟着他们一块亡命天涯。

sentences.english: And, I will also run for my own life.
sentences.chinese: 我自己也要从此亡命天涯了。

sentences.english: Desperado, why don't you come to your senses?
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，为什么你还不清醒？

sentences.english: In the old West, outlaws sometimes tuck up the stage coaches.
sentences.chinese: 昔日的西部，有时亡命徒会劫持驿站马车。

sentences.english: I don't want to run anymore.
InChina, Zhang lived as a fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，张活得像一名亡命天涯的人。

sentences.english: Want to find someone to accompany me to watch the sunrise sunset, and accompany me to the fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 想要找个人陪莪看日出黄昏，顺便陪莪亡命天涯。

sentences.english: Desperado, oh, you ain't gettin no younger.
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，噢，你已不再年轻。

sentences.english: Desperado, why dont you come to your senses?
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，为何不步向你的感觉？

sentences.english: Desperado, oh, you ain't getting no younger.
sentences.chinese: 亡命之徒，哦，你已经年华老去。

definition: to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
